name: biomni-analyze-fatty-acid-composition-by-gc
title: Biomni: Analyze Fatty Acid Composition By Gc
description: Analyzes fatty acid composition in tissue samples using gas chromatography data.
content:
Overview

Analyzes fatty acid composition in tissue samples using gas chromatography (GC) data. This tool processes GC chromatograms to identify and quantify individual fatty acids, calculating their relative percentages and ratios, which provides insights into lipid metabolism, membrane composition, and nutritional status.

Input Parameters

  • gc_data_file (required): Path to gas chromatography data file (CSV or text format)
  • tissue_type (required): Type of tissue analyzed (e.g., 'brain', 'liver', 'adipose', 'plasma')
  • sample_id (required): Unique identifier for the sample
  • output_directory (optional, default='./results'): Directory for output files and reports

Input Format

{
  "gc_data_file": "/path/to/gc_chromatogram.csv",
  "tissue_type": "brain",
  "sample_id": "BRN_001",
  "output_directory": "./results"
}

Biological Use Case

This analysis is valuable for:

  • Characterizing lipid profiles in metabolic disorders (obesity, diabetes, cardiovascular disease)
  • Studying omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acid balance in health and disease
  • Evaluating dietary interventions and nutritional supplementation effects
  • Investigating membrane lipid changes in neurodegeneration
  • Assessing fatty acid oxidation disorders
  • Quality control for lipidomics research and food science

Output

Returns comprehensive fatty acid analysis including:

  • Individual fatty acid percentages (C14:0, C16:0, C18:0, C18:1, C18:2, C20:4, C22:6, etc.)
  • Saturated, monounsaturated, and polyunsaturated fatty acid totals
  • Omega-3 to omega-6 ratio
  • Unsaturation index
  • Summary statistics and visualization plots

Category

physiology
